candidates.title: Fix panic for a bad time interval in `GET /b/:bucket/:entry/q`
candidates.body:
Closes #356 

### Please check if the PR fulfills these requirements

- [x] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [ ] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)
- [x] CHANGELOG.md has been updated (for bug fixes / features / docs)


### What kind of change does this PR introduce?

Bug fix

### What is the current behavior?

See #356 

### What is the new behavior?

The storage checks the wrong time interval and returns `422 Unprocessable Content` instead of panicking.

### Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

No

candidates.title: Provisioning buckets and tokens with environment variables
candidates.body:
Closes #329 

### Please check if the PR fulfills these requirements

- [x] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [x] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)
- [x] CHANGELOG.md has been updated (for bug fixes / features / docs)


### What kind of change does this PR introduce?

Feature

### What is the current behavior?

See #329 

### What is the new behavior?

A user can provision buckets and tokens by using environment variables. For example:


```
RS_BUCKET_A_NAME=bucket-1
RS_BUCKET_A_QUOTA_TYPE=FIFO
RS_BUCKET_A_QUOTA_SIZE=1Tb

RS_BUCKET_B_NAME=bucket-2

RS_TOKEN_A_NAME=token
RS_TOKEN_A_VALUE=somesecret
RS_TOKEN_A_READ=bucket-1,bucket-2
```

### Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

No

### Other information:

candidates.title: Add health-check to Docker image
candidates.body:
Closes #300 

### Please check if the PR fulfills these requirements

- [x] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [ ] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)
- [x] CHANGELOG.md has been updated (for bug fixes / features / docs)


### What kind of change does this PR introduce?

Bug fix

### What is the current behavior?

See #300 

### What is the new behavior?

I've implemented the health check using the `reduct-cli server alive' command. It only worked with aliases, which was inconvenient in the dockerfile. I've added an option to use URL instead of alias:

```
reduct-cli server alive http://token@127.0.0.1:8383
```

### Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

No

### Other information:

candidates.title: Change License to BUSL-1.1
candidates.body:
This PR moves our current licensing model to adopt the Business Source License 1.1 (BUSL-1.1).

Changes Made:
- Updated the LICENSE file to reflect BUSL-1.1
- Modified copyright headers in the core product files to reference BUSL-1.1.
- Added LICENSE files for folders under the MPL-2.0 license

candidates.title: Add Rust
candidates.body:
Closes #

### Please check if the PR fulfills these requirements

- [x] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [x] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)
- [x] CHANGELOG.md have been updated (for bug fixes / features / docs)


### What kind of change does this PR introduce?

Change stack

### What is the current behavior?

The database is written entirely in C++20. Currently it is getting harder to develop this codebase, especially for multiple platforms. Currently, I have encountered these problems:

1. Cross-compilation is not possible because of a bug in the protobuf conan package.
2. We use conan as a package manager,. After the release of conan 2.0, some dependencies stopped updating.
3. Writing an HTTP API in C++ is ugly
4. The codebase can be compiled only with GCC or VS, we can't use clion because of a lack of support C++20
5. CI infrastructure with two docker images is too expensive


### What is the new behavior?

I've ntegrated Rust into CMake scripts and we can use rust code in C++ by using the `cxx.rs` library. My plan is to start migrating from base classes and re-write all the levels of the application step by step.

### Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

No

### Other information:
